Html:
Hi,

Been going around in circles trying to install sample DB's as a complete novice on SQL Server just to start the tutorials.
After a bit of messing I have managed to find the scripts and run them, however the DB's are empty, not sure if this is correct and get errors around objects.

I have searched the forum tried the restore command with C: drive address but didn't seem to like that.


Found the other post about .BAK file doesn't seem to like that either. 
 - FROM DISK = 'C:\Program Files\Microsoft SQL Server\100\Tools\Samples\AdventureWorks2008.bak';
Msg 5133, Level 16, State 1, Line 1
Directory lookup for the file "C:\Program Files\Microsoft SQL Server\MSSQL10.SQLSERVER2008\MSSQL\DATA\AdventureWorks2008_Data.mdf" failed with the operating system error 3(The system cannot find the path specified.).
Msg 3156, Level 16, State 3, Line 1
File 'AdventureWorks2008_Data' cannot be restored to 'C:\Program Files\Microsoft SQL Server\MSSQL10.SQLSERVER2008\MSSQL\DATA\AdventureWorks2008_Data.mdf'. Use WITH MOVE to identify a valid location for the file.
Msg 5133, Level 16, State 1, Line 1
Directory lookup for the file "C:\Program Files\Microsoft SQL Server\MSSQL10.SQLSERVER2008\MSSQL\DATA\AdventureWorks2008_Log.ldf" failed with the operating system error 3(The system cannot find the path specified.).
Msg 3156, Level 16, State 3, Line 1
File 'AdventureWorks2008_Log' cannot be restored to 'C:\Program Files\Microsoft SQL Server\MSSQL10.SQLSERVER2008\MSSQL\DATA\AdventureWorks2008_Log.ldf'. Use WITH MOVE to identify a valid location for the file.
Msg 5121, Level 16, State 2, Line 1
The path specified by "C:\Program Files\Microsoft SQL Server\MSSQL10.SQLSERVER2008\MSSQL\DATA\Documents" is not in a valid directory.
Msg 3156, Level 16, State 3, Line 1
File 'FileStreamDocuments' cannot be restored to 'C:\Program Files\Microsoft SQL Server\MSSQL10.SQLSERVER2008\MSSQL\DATA\Documents'. Use WITH MOVE to identify a valid location for the file.
Msg 3119, Level 16, State 1, Line 1
Problems were identified while planning for the RESTORE statement. Previous messages provide details.
Msg 3013, Level 16, State 1, Line 1
RESTORE DATABASE is terminating abnormally.
Am I being really dumb and missing an instruction for importing data or something, havent really got into the "Getting Started" tutorial as I wanted to install the DB's first.

Sorry for asking for the 500th time or so but I have been around in circles and can't seem to see the wood for the trees at the minute and it doesn't help that I haven't got a clue what I am doing.

Thanks for any help, if not as least you had a laugh reading it.

Howdy, samad. I'm going to shoot you a private message and since you're starting from zero, it might be easier to help you via a more interactive medium. If you're far out of the Pacific timezone, we'll still work something out.

BTW, when you installed the MSI, is there a reason you didn't select the automatic restore feature?
